intro: Fridericia floribunda, commonly known as the showy fridericia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its clusters of showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Fridericia floribunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
